        Throws:

      • queryByCss

        public WebElements queryByCss(java.lang.String css)
                       throws CalabashException
        returns a list of visible WebElements in the WebView corresponding to the css. It is recommended to query for a single element uniquely by css, since indexed query doesn't work for webelements
        Parameters:
        css - elements' css property
        Returns:
        Throws:
        CalabashException

      • queryByCss

        public WebElements queryByCss(java.lang.String css,
                     boolean disableVisibilityFilter)
                       throws CalabashException
        returns a list of WebElements in the WebView corresponding to the css. It is recommended to query for a single element uniquely by css, since indexed query doesn't work for webelements
        Parameters:
        css - elements' css property
        disableVisibilityFilter - should search for all the elements including those not visible in the viewport?
        Returns:
        Throws:
        CalabashException

      • waitFor

        public void waitFor(ICondition condition,
           WaitOptions options)
             throws CalabashException,
                    OperationTimedoutException
        Waits for the specified condition with the options specified
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition to wait for
        options - Wait options
        Throws:
        CalabashException - When any calabash operations fails
        OperationTimedoutException - When the operation elapsed the timeout period

                   int timeout)
                     throws CalabashException,
                            OperationTimedoutException
        Wait for an activity to come on the screen
        Parameters:
        activityName - the activity name which you want to wait for
        timeout - in seconds to timeout when condition fails resulting CalabashException

        CalabashException

      • setGPSCoordinates

        public void setGPSCoordinates(double latitude,
                     double longitude)
                       throws CalabashException
        Modify the gps co-ordinates of your emulator 
         Note: * you have to turn on 'Allow mock location' on the emulator
       * manifest should have android.permission.ACCESS_MOCK_LOCATION permission to change the location
        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        Throws:
        CalabashException

      • setGPSLocation

        public void setGPSLocation(java.lang.String location)
                    throws CalabashException
        Modify the gps co-ordinates of your emulator. You can specify the location like 'Bangalore, India' and set the co-ordinates with the best match using GeoCoder 
         Note: * you have to turn on 'Allow mock location' on the emulator
       * manifest should have android.permission.ACCESS_MOCK_LOCATION permission to change the location
        Parameters:
        location -
        Throws:
        CalabashException

      • getRootElements

        public java.util.List<TreeNode> getRootElements()
                                         throws CalabashException
        Gets all the root elements available This can be used to make a tree view of all the elements available in the view currently
        Returns:
        list of root elements if available, null otherwise
        Throws:
        CalabashException

      • drag

        public void drag(int fromX,
        int toX,
        int fromY,
        int toY,
        int steps)
          throws CalabashException
        click and drag from (fromX, fromY) to (toX, toY) where X and Y axis start at top left corner
        Parameters:
        fromX - source x-coordinate normalized to screen width
        toX - destination x-coordinate normalized to screen width
        fromY - source y-coordinate normalized to screen height
        toY - destination y-coordinate normalized to screen height
        steps - no.of steps that it takes between the two points
        Throws:
        CalabashException

      • performCalabashAction

        public ActionResult performCalabashAction(java.lang.String action,
                                 java.lang.String... args)
                                   throws CalabashException
        call calabash's perform_action function with action and its corresponding args eg: performCalabashAction("click_on_screen","50","100");
        Parameters:
        action - action to be performed
        args - list of arguments for the action
        Throws:
        CalabashException

                  throws CalabashException

        Throws:
        CalabashException
